column4: anyone have any idea why ubuntu would boot correctly after hanging during one boot, and visa versa?
do you hibernate it?
no
when it hangs, what does it say before hanging itself?
in fact, I think it will boot after hibernating
it hangs on a blank ("dead") screen
it appears to be just as gnome is loading
can you get a login prompt by pressing Ctrl+Alt+F1 when it hangs?
no, and ctrl-alt-del will not reboot, either
when I reboot the computer manually to recover from the hang, it boots fine
can you copy /var/log/messages to a pastie?
seems that it hangs after a proper shutdown... right?
correct
can you give me contents of /etc/fstab?
yeah, I think (running a mandriva live cd right now)
try to run fsck.ext3 on your linux partition (make sure its not mounted!)
ok, but I don't see what that would have to do with only being able to boot every other time :)
ok, I have the fstab file, do you still need it? it only has the mount info for the cdrom (/dev/hdc) and root (/)
are you sure its your linux's fstab? and not live cd's fstab?
no :)
make it sure then
